title: UPnP not discovered
body:
I built v0.9.18 from source on linux amd64.

I0509 13:47:01.427490   19131 nat.go:94] network port 30303 could not be mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered

However, I'm pretty sure my router has UPnP enabled, http://i.imgur.com/mf3xcD4.png

Routers don't give descriptive error messages unfortunately :-( There can be a whole range of things that have happened when it tried to map the port. UPnP uses SOAP over HTTP and my router for example occasionally decides to give 500 errors which also gives this exact error. Unfortunately this is a very common problem and there isn't a lot we can do :-(

eth from cpp-ethereum works fine,

```
  ℹ  06:00:38|p2p  UPnP device: http://192.168.2.1:1780/InternetGatewayDevice.xml [st: urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:InternetGatewayDevice:1 ]
⧎ ℹ  06:00:38|p2p  Punched through NAT and mapped local port 30303 onto external port 30303 .
```

To help you track down the problem, I made wireshark recordings. Here is geth,

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwpGqX45kuYIU29OLTJTWWhlOWs/view?usp=sharing

and here is eth

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwpGqX45kuYIbGY3X0JEOHJnbVU/view?usp=sharing
Interesting. Thanks
Will look at the traces later.

I have the same problem, upnp is on and working for for CppEth9.17, but not Geth9.19. 

The exact error i get is
`network port 30303 could not be mapped: goupnp: SOAP request got HTTP 500 Internal Server Error`

If there's any log I can provide to help, I'd be happy to.

Same here...

I0510 15:47:36.412071    5252 nat.go:94] network port 30303 could not be mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered

Dont remember having this problem a few months ago when I had Geth working on same ISP/router config.

Me too:

I0510 17:16:47.908137   23888 nat.go:94] network port 30303 could not be
mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered

Even though it's been working for weeks.

On 10 May 2015 at 15:54, deskenny notifications@github.com wrote:

> Same here...
> 
> I0510 15:47:36.412071 5252 nat.go:94] network port 30303 could not be
> mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered
> 
> Dont remember having this problem a few months ago when I had Geth working
> on same ISP/router config.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/890#issuecomment-100652852
> .
mmmm... I got it going. Went into router and checked. Upnp was disabled (always must have been). Either the need is new, or I just didn't notice the error before. Anyway, works now for me

> `network port 30303 could not be mapped: goupnp: SOAP request got HTTP 500 Internal Server Error`

Go to your router interface and disable / save and enable / save your UPnP settings on your router to restart the SOAP service on your router. 

> `network port 30303 could not be mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered`

**usually** means UPnP is disabled. Please make sure it's on.

@obscuren 

```

Go to http://miniupnp.free.fr/ or http://miniupnp.tuxfamily.org/
for more information.

```

So armed with this, I removed the PPA (as I was unclear as to if it had been updated or not), and did

```
git clone https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum.git && cd go-ethereum && make geth 

geth

   Welcome to the
      FRONTIER

I0511 01:11:59.377327   12243 backend.go:236] Protocol Version: 60, Network Id: 0

I0511 01:11:59.378502   12243 chain_manager.go:235] Last block (#0) fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca TD=0

I0511 01:12:01.474839   12243 udp.go:189] Listening, enode://4625c2043463abcbf3849dc1bb46e7cf4eef88156e5463979f18070dde7d5041bae4dd83caa54c48c236e78df6316603fb423bc8dbb911b46090dbac8d354175@86.145.29.54:30303

```

```


```
@stephantual thanks! @fjl PTAL
FYI updated to latest devel commit and still no dice.

```
                                                                                  Will update this issue once I‎ have looked into it.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           ‎
```

```
                                                                                  Please note that UPNP is not required for connecting to the network.
```

> Please note that UPNP is not required for connecting to the network.

Curious, what is the benefit of a working UPNP?

> Curious, what is the benefit of a working UPNP?

In theory, it enables your router to automatically allow inbound connections from other nodes to your local machine. This should result in better network connectivity and without it, you have to rely on making outbound connection and hoping those peers aren't behind a firewall or NAT that would normally block such traffic.

tldr;better connectivity resulting in healthier network

@jpritikin I have looked into the capture files. Unfortunately, they only contain the multicast SSDP traffic. The bug seems to be in the part after the SSDP search, in the SOAP communication.

Would it be possible for you to do another capture including the unicast HTTP traffic?

@fjl Sure. Here is geth,

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwpGqX45kuYIdC1yc0loQW1uUGM/view?usp=sharing

Here is eth,

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwpGqX45kuYIaFFQRHVWaE04VTg/view?usp=sharing

Let me know if you need anything else.
@jpritikin please test again with the latest develop branch. the problem should be fixed now.

I can confirm that it appears to be working,

```
I0514 07:45:39.583452   17705 ssdp.go:63] ssdp: got unexpected search target result "urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:WANConnectionDevice:1"
I0514 07:45:39.583529   17705 ssdp.go:63] ssdp: got unexpected search target result "urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:WANConnectionDevice:1"
I0514 07:45:39.583570   17705 ssdp.go:63] ssdp: got unexpected search target result "urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:WANConnectionDevice:1"
I0514 07:45:39.621614   17705 udp.go:189] Listening, enode://b820c9f02cf880d162e24e42a55f868c3e69bd92324476eec675a52ca2bea43bdbc0be2def6be900b6d1a851c1724f11d48514dcb4cdadee53788fea47796729@73.171.34.52:30303
I0514 07:45:39.621740   17705 backend.go:456] Server started
I0514 07:45:39.621827   17705 server.go:349] Listening on [::]:30303
I0514 07:45:39.628702   17705 nat.go:95] mapped network port udp:30303 -> 30303 (ethereum discovery) using UPNP IGDv1-IP1
> I0514 07:45:39.649502   17705 nat.go:95] mapped network port tcp:30303 -> 30303 (ethereum p2p) using UPNP IGDv1-IP1
```

can confirm this fixes it. 

```
24357 nat.go:95] mapped network port udp:30303 -> 30303 (ethereum discovery) using UPNP IGDv1-IP1
```

Thank you SO MUCH guys. This really helps
Ah, spoke too soon, the client never gets any peers now.

I have observed exactly the same problem with geth 1.3.5, it indicate that it have mapped the udp port using UPNP but in reality the UPNP mapping is not visible in the router configuration and the synchro is drop down after few minutes.
Im Having the same problem, I cant connect to any peers. Im using homestead release, any fix?
I'm having the same issue.
I find a way to fixed it, it seems that geth cant get the external ip, so I send it on the arguments like: --nat "extip:YOUR_PUBLIC_IP"
Same issue here:   1.4.9-stable-b7e3dfc5 any work around?

I get this message when running geth console.

> > E0313 08:49:44.752880 p2p/nat/nat.go:124] Network port udp:30303 could not be mapped: no UPnP or NAT-PMP router discovered


I wanted to know whether having this issue will cause problem for my node in syncing blockchain. I don't intend to do any mining on my node. I just want it use it as a wallet... create accounts, transfer ether and so on.
